WorkItem.Description:
In addition to id# 9585.
Although I just shortly work with WPF and my knowledge of it is still increasing, I made the following observation (and maybe not completely correct) :
 
When the DatePicker looses focus, invalid data wil automatically be reset to the last date. Since it is it rather SelectedDate-based than Text-based. 
Maybe the user accidently 1-122-2009 instead of 1-12-2009. He can change his mistake by only removing this single character...
... or instead I should do some key-previewing. 
Also other controls tend to do this. You see this behaviour also in other software, so maybe I have to get used to it. 
 
In my opinion the Binding should stay in a sort of errorstate where refreshing temporarily is froozen.
But you cannot change properties after binding. Why?
And you can not inherit the Binding, other than like this: http://www.hardcodet.net/2008/04/wpf-custom-binding-class. Why?
Object Orientation is not ment - I think - to seal so much off. After several years of experience I know that I cannot forsee everything, or how things will be used.
 
Greetings Eric Gehring,
www.softex.nl
WorkItem.Summary: DatePicker can not temporarily hold invalid date

Comments.Message: I ofcourse ment: "He can NOT change his mistake by only removing this single character...

I think you should be able to make a ValidationRule that checks for this invalid date.  If you do this, it may not commit the binding until it's valid, which would give the user a chance to fix the mistake.

Hi SoftexNL,

Thanks for the feedback.  We are tracking this suggestion as a potential feature for a future release of DatePicker.

Alexis
